name: ripple cardigan
notes:
> row-by-row yoke shaping is now
> included in the pattern.

**size**
xs (s) m (l) xl (2xl) 3xl (4xl) 5xl

**measurements**
finished bust size: 85.5 (95) 104 (113.5) 127 (136) 145.5 (155.5) 165 cm / 33.5 (37.5) 41 (44.5) 50 (53.5) 57.5 (61) 65“

cardigan length: 55 (56) 57 (59) 60 (61) 62 (62) 62 cm / 21.5 (22) 22.5 (23) 23.5 (24) 24.5 (24.5) 24.5“

for a fitted look, choose a size with approx. 10 cm / 4” positive ease. for an oversized look, choose a size with approx. 25 - 35 cm / 9.75 - 13.75” positive ease. model is 180 cm / 5' 10.9" tall and is wearing the cardigan with a 35 cm / 13.75” positive ease.

**materials**
7 (8) 8 (9) 10 (11) 11 (13) 13 balls of 
highland wool col. 36
*1200 (1325) 1425 (1600) 1725 (1850) 1975 (2200) 2250 meters/
1310 (1450) 1560 (1750) 1885 (2025) 2160 (2405) 2460 yards*

6 x 15 mm “marguerit” buttons from go handmade

**needles**
circular needle 3 mm (us 2½) 40-80 cm/16-32”
circular needle 3.5 mm (us4) 40-80 cm/16-32”

**yarn quality**
highland wool, hobbii
100 % peruvian highland wool
50 g / 1.8 oz = 175 m / 191 yds

**gauge**
24 sts x 32 rows = 10 cm x 10 cm / 4” x 4
in stockinette stitch after blocking.

**pattern information**
this classic v-neck cardigan is knitted seamlessly from top down in compound raglan shaping. the back and sleeves are all knitted in plain stockinette stitches, while the front features simple but beautiful ripple laces. once the body is completed, before working on the hem, knit the front rib bands first and join them to the front cardigan while working on them. lastly, work both sleeves in the round, finishing with a long cuff in ripple laces.
